P H O N E ( 2 1 6 ) 2 3 3 - 3 6 4 9 • E - M A I L J D R E Y F U S S 0 5 @ YA H O O. C O M
J O S E P H E . D R E Y F U S S
EDUCATION
Rice University, Houston, TX
Graduation: May, 2009
Bachelor of Arts in Sport Management
Additional Course Work: Mechanical engineering, systems
evaluation and analysis
James A. Baker Residential College
SPORTS INTERNSHIP EXPERIENCE
Video Intern and Archivist, Houston Dynamo, Houston, TX
(January, 2009-May, 2009)
Duties: Camera work, film transfer and editing. Created a
catalogue and database of all tape footage shot by the team since
inception in 2006.
Publicist, Event Management Class/Rice Owl Bowl 2, Rice
University, Houston, TX
(January, 2009-April, 2009)
Duties: Writing press and publicity materials for the event,
organizing silent auction, and operations. Wrote all press
materials, which were released by the Houston Chronicle and
Clear Channel and Cumulus radio networks.
Seasonal Intern, Lone Star Sports & Entertainment, Houston, TX
(December, 2008-January, 2009)
Duties: Marketing, public relations and hospitality for the 2008
Texas Bowl. Updated group ticket tracking system for LSSE and
designed several templates for hospitality nametags in continued
use.
Marketing and Game Operations, Rice University Athletic
Department, Houston, TX
(September, 2008-December, 2008)
Duties: Marketing, pregame operations for football games. Led
setup and breakdown of Tailgate Owley, the public pregame
festivities for Rice football games. Tailgate Owley was patronized
by over 3,000 members of alumni groups and paid corporate
groups every week for the enhanced experience provided by Rice.
Marketing, Game Operations, and Statistics, Texas Copperheads
(AF2), Houston, TX
(May, 2008-August, 2008)
Duties
: Sales and marketing, field preparation, statistics.
PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE
Sales Consultant, Helfman Dodge, Houston, TX
(June, 2006-December, 2007)

text.i: Held a position with an average turnover of 90 days for 18 months.

page.text: Barback, State Bar and Lounge, Houston, TX
ADDITIONAL INTERNSHIP EXPERIENCE
Guidance, Navigation and Control Dept., Orbital Sciences
Corporation, Chandler, AZ
(May, 2004-August, 2004)
Duties: Large-quantity Monte Carlo simulations for missile launch
and guidance preparation. Code update and revision for
interpretation and presentation of simulations.
Research Assistant, Case Western Reserve University, Cleveland, OH
Duties: Monitoring and preparation of test equipment, as well as
recording and indexing of results.
ADDITIONAL ACTIVITIES
Rice University Clubs and Activities:
Competed at Yale, Texas A&M, Washington University in St. Louis,
Tulane University, University of Texas
Team Winner, Rice Intramural College Bowl Tournament (2002,
Baker Residential College Activities:
Coordinated and supervised intramural and intercollegiate sports
activities at Baker and chose coaches for intercollegiate teams.
Maintained and loaned out sports equipment owned by Baker
Residential College.
Player (2001), Coach (2002-2004) As coach, installed a West Coast
style offense and the team scored its first offensive touchdowns in
several seasons.
Theater:
Carpenter: “King Lear,” “Othello,” “Cymbeline,” “Richard III”
Head Carpenter: “The Taming of the Shrew,” “The Tempest” (2004-
Actor: Hortensio in “The Taming of the Shrew” (2005)
Other:
